node.title: 'Spreading like wildfire': Nightclub COVID cluster's six days of turbocharged infections
node.alt: the inside of a hotel drinking area
node.description: It's taken just six days for the Newcastle nightclub COVID-19 cluster to surpass last year's northern beaches outbreak. This is why it's spreading so quickly.
node.content:
["Two clusters,\u00a0both responsible for hundreds of COVID-19 infections, accelerated by dancing, drinking and summer socialising.", "But that's where the similarities stop.", "At around 200\u00a0cases and climbing, the COVID-19\u00a0outbreak stemming from a\u00a0Newcastle nightclub is being billed as 2021's\u00a0largest\u00a0superspreader event in Australia.", "It's emerged almost a year to the day after another outbreak\u00a0shut down\u00a0Sydney's northern beaches for several weeks.", "That cluster, driven by transmission at the Avalon RSL and nearby bowling club, peaked at 151 cases after 30 days \u2014\u00a0a number that took just six\u00a0days to reach in this year's Omicron-led Newcastle cluster.", "The latest outbreak started when a person infected with the Omicron variant visited The Argyle House nightclub on December 8.", "They were linked to positive cases identified on a party boat cruise on Sydney Harbour on December 3.", "Yesterday morning, NSW Chief Health Officer Kerry Chant said there were \"about 150\" cases associated with the Argyle cluster but by the afternoon, Health Minister Brad Hazzard confirmed there were \"more than 200\".", "Almost one third\u00a0of the 680 people who checked in to the Argyle with a QR code have been infected, with more cases expected.", "Most of the cases have not yet been confirmed as being the Omicron variant.", "The event has already seeded 200\u00a0infections in one night, far exceeding the 26 primary cases at the Avalon RSL on December 11 last year, and the 28 infections\u00a0at the bowling club two days later.", "David Durrheim, from the Hunter\u00a0New England Local Health District,\u00a0 said the Omicron variant was \"spreading like wildfire\" at pubs, nightclubs and large events.", "\"Because Omicron can spread so quickly \u2026 and because of the high level of transmission at this event, it's probably going to be one of the highest transmission events this year in any single venue probably anywhere in the world,\" Dr Durrheim said.", "Catherine Bennett, chair of epidemiology at Deakin University, said Australia had\u00a0not seen a superspreader event like this before.", "\"We know with Omicron, even with a primary course [of vaccination],\u00a0that we don't have that same protection, obviously, even in young people who have had Pfizer,\" she said.", "She estimated many of the infected people at the nightclub\u00a0would have been vaccinated in the past three months.", "She said there was evidence to suggest the Omicron variant interacted differently with COVID-19 jabs.", "\"They're enough to stop serious illness, we still think and hope. Plus, you've got other bits of your immune system, your cellular response, but Omicron has evaded out that sort of middle run protection we used to have against transmission,\" she said.", "", "
Kerry Chant said she expected\u00a0more cases to be confirmed as Omircon in coming days.(AAP: Jenny Evans)
", "Dr Chant urged everyone to get a booster dose as soon as possible.", "\"You achieve the best level of protection by having the booster dose in relation to Omicron variant,\" she said.", "Dr Chant said there were 85 confirmed cases of the Omicron variant in NSW.", "She said she expected that number\u00a0to go up as genomic sequencing was done around the Newcastle cluster.", "\"We are of the belief that Omnicron transmission is accounting for our increasing case numbers at present.\"", "Dr Durrheim encouraged everyone who attended Newcastle case locations\u00a0to isolate and get tested.", "\"For the rest of us, it's very\u00a0important that we don't wreck Christmas for ourselves and don't put the health services under more pressure,\" he said.", "\"It's very important to consider delaying events that are not essential until after Christmas, once we get on top of this Omicron outbreak.\"", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
